alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; South Central Mountains; Union County; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 15 at 2:39PM MST until February 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of a dusting to 2 inches. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph over northeast NM where near-blizzard conditions have occurred across Union, Colfax, and Harding counties. * WHERE...South Central Mountains, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Harding County, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass, Union County, West Central Mountains, and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Travel is discouraged over northeast NM where road closures have occurred.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Harding County; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; South Central Mountains; Union County; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
